newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's New World Telephone says might float one day.
newsitem.headline: HK's New World Telephone says might float one day.

text.p: New World Telephone, the new telecoms arm of New World Development Ltd, might be spun off sometime in the future but there were no current plans for a listing, chief executive Peter Tsang said on Tuesday.
"New World Telephone will be a listed company sometime in the future," Tsang told a news conference to announce the company's service launch schedule.
But he said the current focus of the telecoms unit was to launch services and build market share.
"We are now very busy trying to build a business," said Tsang, adding that New World aimed to spend HK$3 billion to HK$5 billion over three to five years.
